title: ¿Es posible integrar el Explorador de windows con el de ThunderBird?
content:
Hola, en el explorador de Windows tengo una estructura de árbol que tiene su paralelo casi idéntico en el ThunderBird como puede verse en el adjunto y mi pregunta es: ¿se podrían gestionar los directorios y carpetas de Windows desde el ThunderBird? Ya se que de momento no es posible pero me parece interesante. La utilidad (grande) creo que es evidente, gestionar cualquier asunto desde un único lugar (ThunderBird) ya que cualquier asunto tiene ficheros y comunicaciones y hoy por hoy hay que guardarlos por separado. Saludos cordiales, Josu

Hello, In Windows Explorer I have a tree structure that has an almost identical parallel in ThunderBird as can be seen in the attachment and my question is: could Windows directories and folders be managed from ThunderBird? I know it's not possible at the moment but it seems interesting to me. I think the (great) utility is evident, managing any matter from a single place (ThunderBird) since any matter has files and communications and today they have to be saved separately. Kind regards, Josu
creator: jesus22

title: Message List Pane too long
content:
The new update is a disaster and almost unusable. The biggest problem I have with it is that the Message pane is now reduced to a size that is uncomfortably small. This could be ameliorated if the Message List pane could be shortened, as in previous versions. The current pane cannot be reduced to less than 8 messages in the list, previous versions allowed for far fewer.

Yes, there are several options available to change the layout, but they all have even greater issues.

PLEASE CHANGE THE MESSAGE LIST PANE FORMAT SO THAT IT CAN BE REDUCED TO DISPLAY A SMALLER NUMBER THAN 8 MESSAGES!!!

title: UNABLE TO DELETE MESSAGES FROM MY INBOX
content:
UNABLE TO DELETE MESSAGES FROM MY INBOX

I have a problem with being unable to delete messages from my in box.

I have searched the online support and found a couple of articles going back to 2020:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1292956

and

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1293317

but they seem to relate to an older version, as mine is 115.4.3 (64 bit).

Having taken a backup first, I’ve followed all the instructions including deleting the Trash folders and forcing an index repair without any success.

The problem doesn’t occur on every message and I seem to be able to delete the odd one but at present I have almost 1,000 messages in my inbox awaiting deletion.

I’m using Windows 10 Home, version 22H2, a POP3 account and regularly compact all folders.

The second of the above articles asked for an image of my ‘pop account name’ folder, which is attached.

I hope someone can help me please.

Regards and TIA

Phil

title: Error message "Not Implemented" when trying to attach a word doc -- solution I found for my case
content:
I came here yesterday because of receiving the error message "Not Implemented" when trying to attach a word doc. I found 2 other queries about this that were already archived with no answer. I am posting the solution I found, in case it helps someone else. I don't know if the problem would be caused by anything else, but I found:

It turned out that it was a new file I had just created, and OneDrive was stuck on it trying sync it. Looking at Windows Explorer (directory), the "Status" showed the syncing icon. Microsoft Help acknowledged this when it stated that a reason for pausing the sync is if OneDrive seems to be stuck on a file. So I paused OneDrive sync, but the icon didn't go away and it still wouldn't attach in TB. [To pause, right click on the OneDrive icon in the tray, should see or find Pause as an option.]

I rebooted and the status icons were back to normal, the file attached to TB as per normal.

This has raised a huge number of questions for me about Win 11 and the dominance of OneDrive, which I've only been using for a few weeks, but that's another whole story.
creator: Victoria-nola
